intro: Chaptalia hidalgoensis, commonly known as Hidalgo's chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico, specifically found in the state of Hidalgo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
